tactics.name: apple_strategic_entry
tactics.description: Enter market with significantly better product than existing options
source_quotes: Our objective is never to be first. Our objective is to be best

tactics.name: profitability_first
tactics.description: Prioritize topics with proven market demand by analyzing Amazon sales data and BSR
steps: Ensure scalability with high profit margins
caveats: Avoid saturated niches with low price points
source_quotes: The most important thing you realize that the mark will ignore everything that isn't what they want

tactics.name: BSR and Sales Estimation
tactics.description: Use Amazon's Best Seller Rank and sales calculators to evaluate profitability of a niche
steps: Search for a specific topic (e.g., 'Mediterranean diet cookbook')
Use Book Beam Sales Calculator with BSR and marketplace
source_quotes: The searches will be much more accurate and the majority of the sales that you're gonna make will come from the US

tactics.name: Bestseller List Analysis
tactics.description: Identify profitable niches by analyzing Amazon's bestseller lists and subcategories to find trending topics with high demand.
steps: Check Amazon bestseller lists for real-time demand signals
Drill into subcategories to find specific niches
Look for patterns in bestselling books within categories
caveats: Data may lag behind current trends
source_quotes: Amazon in suggesting the real time what people want through a list with all the best selling books of the moment

heuristics.name: review_threshold_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting
source_quotes: We want to have a very very similar approach in the market

heuristics.name: review_threshold
source_quotes: It's very important even the pricing in this equation

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with lower competition
source_quotes: If it's less than one hundred thousand then it's probably very profitable

claims.statement: KDP success depends on selling books people want, not what authors like
source_quotes: We only sell book the people books that people want

claims.statement: KDP allows verification of profitability through Amazon sales data
source_quotes: If it's something is profitable it means that a lot of people want that product

claims.statement: The US market is the most profitable for KDP authors
source_quotes: The majority of the sales that you're gonna make will come from the US

claims.statement: Kindle Unlimited subscribers pay a monthly fee but authors still receive royalties for books accessed through the service.
source_quotes: The price of the kindle unlimited subscribe meaning that people that pay a monthly fee can take the book basically for free, but we still get the royalties

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identity with problem and unique constraint
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates underserved niche with clear demand signals
source_quotes: We want to have a very very similar approach in the market
